section.title: Part B: Cognitive Style
section.subtitle: HOW DO YOU THINK? - Discover your mental processing preferences
section.description: Answer based on how you naturally approach problems—not how you've been taught.

domains.name: Wholist
domains.description: Big Picture Thinker - Prefers understanding the whole structure first

opposite.name: Analyst
opposite.description: Detail Thinker - Prefers breaking problems into specific steps

domains.name: Verbal
domains.description: Word Processor - Processes information through words and text

opposite.name: Imager
opposite.description: Visual Processor - Thinks in mental images and diagrams

domains.name: Convergent
domains.description: Focused Thinker - Uses logic to find the single correct answer

opposite.name: Divergent
opposite.description: Creative Thinker - Brainstorms multiple creative possibilities

domains.name: Field Dependent
domains.description: Context-Aware - Relies on surrounding context and social cues

opposite.name: Field Independent
opposite.description: Detail-Focused - Isolates specific details from background

domains.name: Reflective
domains.description: Careful Thinker - Takes time to ensure accuracy

opposite.name: Impulsive
opposite.description: Quick Thinker - Responds quickly and spontaneously

questions.text: I like to understand the big picture before looking at the details.
